snippet: A former sheriff’s deputy convicted of using a Taser to shock a restrained detainee who later died was sentenced to a month behind bars.
abstract: Former Georgia Sheriff's Deputy Jason Kenny is sentenced to one month in prison for using Taser to repeatedly shock detainee Mathew Ajibade, who later died; Kenny was acquitted of manslaughter charges in October.
lead_paragraph: A former sheriff’s deputy convicted of using a Taser to shock a restrained detainee who later died was sentenced to a month behind bars.

headline.main: Georgia: Ex-Deputy Gets One Month in Jail Death
headline.print_headline: Georgia: Ex-Deputy Gets One Month in Jail Death
